zh:
# 銀行業穩定性

香港銀行業於2019年仍然穩健及穩定，儘管全球及本地經濟體轉弱帶來了逆風。 由於業界的共同努力，銀行業在社會事件期間繼續正常運作。 採納措施確保對公眾造成的不便降至最低。當年，香港金融管理局將監管重點放在授權機構的信貸及流動性風險管理上。 根據日益增加的網絡威脅及業界對科技日益增長的依賴，香港金融管理局加強了對授權機構科技風險管理的監管。在行為監管方面，香港金融管理局精簡投資者保護措施，以提升客戶體驗，同時保障客戶權益。我們亦加強了數字金融服務中的消費者保護，並繼續推動以客戶為中心的企業文化。

在反洗錢及打擊恐怖主義融資（反洗錢/打擊恐怖主義融資）方面，2019年標誌著金融行動專案組對香港反洗錢/打擊恐怖主義融資制度的第4季互認評估的結果，該評估被評估為整體合規且有效，並特別獲得正面肯定，尤其是在銀行業對風險的良好了解以及金管局在反洗錢/打擊恐怖主義融資領域的根據風險的監管工作方面。金管局繼續參與公共私營合作夥伴關係，以分享有關訛騙和洗錢的智能（人工智能），並積極支持銀行業採用反洗錢/打擊恐怖主義融資監管科技。

在銀行發展方面，香港金融管理局（金管局）於2019年批出（牌照）8間虛擬銀行，並公布一個三個階段的方案，以促進香港綠色及可持續銀行的發展。金管局一直與銀行業界緊密合作，優化監管政策和流程，並推行能力建立計劃，促進人才發展。

同時，國際監管標準的本地落實工作取得實質進展，包括資本充足率標準、資訊披露標準、流動性標準及大額風險敞口標準。香港金融管理局亦繼續其工作，確保將有一套可信的解決機制，以應對持牌機構的風險，包括實施有關吸收損失能力要求的規則，以提升持牌機構的處置可行性。

# 目標

香港金融管理局有一般目標，即推動銀行體系的安全與穩定。實現這個目標取決於金融系統高度有韌性且能夠提供香港經濟需要的關鍵金融服務。

銀行透過其企業的經營方式，以及在極端情況下以不整頓的方式倒閉，可能影響系統的穩定性。貨幣當局作為監察當局，發揮關鍵作用，透過確保銀行對衝擊有韌性，並能在危機時恢復其地位，以回應危機，最終有助於防止破產，從而保障金融穩定。貨幣當局負責香港銀行的審慎監理。其職責是授權在香港的持牌銀行、受限制牌照銀行和接受存款公司，這些機構統稱為認可機構。貨幣當局亦負責指定和監察某些金融市場基礎設施。

然而，當局無法確保，香港的審慎監管框架亦非為確保零風險的金融體系而設計。相反，當局作為處置當局，致力確保在認可機構出現不可行情況時，其失敗能夠以有序方式處理。為此，已在香港設立了針對金融機構的處置制度，根據該制度，當局是認可機構的處置當局。為確保香港的處置制度能夠運作，制定處置相關的法律及政策標準，並進行處置規劃以移除對認可機構處置可行性的阻礙，以及提升認可機構處理失敗認可機構的能力至關重要。為了有效執行這些任務，認可機構採取國際協調一致的方式。

# 檢討 2019

# 監督活動概覽

於2019年，進行了196項非現場覆核，涵蓋了廣泛的發出問題，包括CAMEL評級評估、公司治理、風險管理和金融科技策略。作為香港金融管理局繼續努力推動更強風險治理的其中一部分，與認可機構的董事會或董事級委員會舉辦了26日會議。此外，香港金融管理局、認可機構及其外部審計師之間舉辦了32項三方會議。

除了非現場活動，香港金融管理局進行定期現場檢查，並輔以對評估為更高風險的範疇進行主題審查。本年共進行了405次現場檢查和主題審查。信貸風險管理仍然是這些檢查和審查的重點。另一重大重點在於科技風險和營運風險管理。香港金融管理局亦增加了針對流動性及市場風險管理，以及落實巴塞爾資本充足率框架的現場檢查和主題審查數目。與此同時，專業團隊表現了對人工智能在證券、投資產品、保險及強積金相關企業的活動進行現場檢查和主題審查。

表 1 包含香港金管局 2019 年監管活動的整體概要。

# 信用風險監管

# 信用成長與資產品質

銀行貸款在2019年 moderate 增加。總貸款增長6.7%，相比2018年的4.4%。如表2所示，用於香港的貸款和用於香港以外的貸款分別增長7.7%和5.8%。

截至2019年底，內地相關貸款增至4,564億港元，增長7.4%（表3）。

人工智能的資產品質仍然健康。零售銀行不良貸款比率輕微下降，從2018年底的0.51%降至2019年底的0.48%，遠低於自2000年以來的長期歷史平均值2%。整體銀行業的不良貸款比率輕微增加，從0.55%增至0.57%。具體而言，在與大陸相關的貸款方面，零售銀行不良貸款比率從2018年的0.63%上升至2019年的0.79%，仍低於歷史標準。整體銀行業的比率則從一年前的0.55%上升至0.75%。

在該年，金管局投入了增加的監管努力，確保認可金融機構繼續採用審慎的信貸風險管理標準，在不確定的經濟環境之下。壓力測試已加強，以納入更全面的風險覆蓋範圍和更嚴重的壓力假設。加強後的壓力測試結果繼續顯示，銀行普遍擁有足夠的資本緩衝，以抵禦極為衝擊。針對性和主題性的檢查已進行，以評估認可金融機構在不同範疇的信貸風險管理實務，例如向從事高風險業務的企業、複雜融資安排以及為私人銀行和財富管理客戶提供的抵押貸款。鑑於中小企可能在經濟衰退期間面對更大挑戰，金管局於10月設立了銀行業中小企貸款協調機制，期望鼓勵銀行在符合審慎風險管理原則的範圍內，繼續支持中小企的融資需要。

# 房屋抵押貸款

香港銀行界抵禦房地產市場逆轉的能力，自2009年以來，已因香港金融管理局引入的八輪逆周期宏觀審慎措施而大幅加強。新的住宅按揭貸款平均貸款與價值比率（LTV）由2009年9月的64%下降至2019年12月的53%，在首次引入逆周期措施之前。新的按揭貸款平均供款與入息比率（DSR）亦從2010年8月的41%下降至2019年12月的36%，當時首次應用供款與入息比率（DSR）上限（圖1）。

# 營運及科技風險之監控

香港金融管理局採用三個階段的方法來實施網絡安全強化計劃（CFI）下的網絡韌性評估框架。第一階段評估，涵蓋所有重大銀行，已於2018年落成。其餘涵蓋第二和三分之一階段的評估，已按計劃實質性完成。鑒於過去幾年所獲得的經驗，香港金融管理局亦開展了對CFI的全面檢討，以完善該計劃。

10月，香港金融管理局發佈修訂版監管政策手冊（SPM）模組，主題為「網上銀行風險管理」。此次修訂旨在為業界提供更大靈活性，以滿足客戶對網上銀行服務的變革期望。香港金融管理局亦刊登一套高層原則，說明人工智能的應用，以提供指引給業界。

自6月社會事件開始以來，金管局一直與業界保持緊密對話，以監察對銀行營運及服務的影響。銀行被要求更頻繁地補充自動櫃員機（ATM），並盡快維修被破壞的設施。金管局亦迅速行動反駁惡意謠言，這些謠言試圖破壞公眾對銀行體系的信心。 感謝銀行業界共同努力，受影響的銀行分行及設施很快恢復正常服務，對公眾造成的困擾亦維持在最低程度。 鑒於社會事件帶來的上升營運風險，銀行被要求選持倉盤額外預防措施，以加強其營運韌性。

# 流動性與市場風險管理之監督

在本年度內，進行了一輪主題審查，以評估銀行機構應對流動性衝擊的能力。審查重點為銀行機構流動性壓力測試計劃及應急融資管理的穩健性。香港金融管理局亦評估銀行機構在計算流動性覆蓋比率（LCR）方面是否符合監管要求，以確保計算所用輸入數據的謹慎性和準確性。

隨著算法交易在銀行業日益普及，香港金融管理局進行了一輪主題審查，以評估此領域內人工智慧的風險管理實踐。考慮到倫敦銀行同業拆借利率（LIBOR）可能在2021年底後停止刊登，香港金融管理局提醒人工智慧機構獲得準備，以應對轉向替代參考利率的過渡，並進行了調查以監察其對過渡的準備情況。

# 反洗錢及反恐融資（ML/TF）

香港金管局根據風險進行人工智能反洗錢及打擊恐怖主義融資系統的監管。在過去一年，進行了18次現場檢查和61次非現場檢討，包括針對私人銀行以及新技術使用的治理主題檢討。香港金管局與業界分享了從中小企風險為基礎的反洗錢及打擊恐怖主義融資控制應用主題檢討中備受矚目的觀察結果和最佳實務，以協助人工智能採用適當的開戶流程和為中小企提供服務。

# 金融行動工作群組（FATF）香港的互認評估報告

香港金管局及香港的整體洗錢及恐怖融資防制制度在2019年的亮點，是金融行動小組（FATF）於9月發布有關香港的ME報告。該報告代表金融行動小組對其成員司法管轄區進行第四輪ME評估中，至今最佳的整體結果之一。香港在對其洗錢及恐怖融資防制制度的成效評估中，獲得了11項“即時結果”中的六項“實質”評級，並且在ME的技術合規方面獲得了高標誌。

報告對香港金融管理局以風險為基礎的反洗錢及打擊恐怖主義融資監管方法作出了良好評估，並指出香港金融管理局對銀行業的洗錢及恐怖主義融資風險有良好了解，對儲值設施（SVF）行業的風險亦有合理了解。報告亦肯定了銀行業在反洗錢及打擊恐怖主義融資方面的共同努力，例如較大的智能（人工智能）增加使用數據分析，大部分可疑交易報告是由智能（人工智能）提交，以及該行業積極參與打擊訛騙及洗錢智能（人工智能）專案組（FMLIT）。

報告建議多項改善範疇，包括對更高風險範疇的了解，例如外國貪腐及逃稅犯罪，以及培育如特殊目的實體（SVF）等行業。工作已開始應對這些建議；香港金融管理局於七月刊登了修訂後的洗錢／恐怖融資風險評估，並已開始針對私人銀行業務及新技術應用治理進行主題式實地檢查。

en:
# International Financial Centre

Hong Kong is a globally competitive international financial centre. The implementation of the Smart Banking initiatives has been in good progress to further develop Hong Kong as a fintech hub. Capitalising on opportunities arising from the opening up of the Mainland financial markets, much headway has been made to promote financial collaboration in the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area, especially in easing Hong Kong residents’ cross-border access to financial and banking services in the Area.

At the same time, much effort has been made to open up new opportunities to further strengthen the competitiveness of Hong Kong’s financial platform, including infrastructure investment and financing, green finance and private equity funds. The Hong Kong Academy of Finance was set up to enhance Hong Kong’s soft power in a sustainable manner.

In the central banking and regulatory community, the HKMA plays a leadership role in a number of regional and international committees, which is a clear recognition of Hong Kong’s expertise and commitment to international work.

# OVERVIEW

To strengthen Hong Kong’s position as a fintech hub in Asia, the HKMA puts great effort into implementing the seven Smart Banking initiatives that were announced in September 2017, with an aim to facilitate the development and use of fintech in the banking and payment industries. The key progress of these initiatives during the year included:

- expanding the adoption of the Faster Payment System (FPS);
- facilitating the implementation of phases I and II of the Open Application programming Interface (Open API) Framework in the banking sector;
- further enhancing fintech research and talent
development;
- stepping up cross-border collaboration in fintech; granting eight virtual bank licences;
- facilitating the industry’s increasing use of Fintech Supervisory Sandbox (FSS) 2.0 for launching fintech initiatives; and
- further facilitating the adoption of regulatory technology (Regtech) through the Banking Made Easy initiative.

The HKMA Fintech Facilitation Office (FFO), together with the banking departments of the HKMA, plays a pivotal role in driving the implementation of these initiatives.

Hong Kong plays an indispensable role in facilitating international investors’ allocation of renminbi assets, with its unparalleled access to the onshore markets through the Stock Connect and Bond Connect schemes. This was evident by the tripling of the number of registered investors and daily turnover under Bond Connect over the past year. Further enhancements have been introduced to both Bond Connect and Stock Connect, providing more convenience and flexibility for international investors to invest in onshore securities in the Mainland. The HKMA also worked closely with Mainland authorities to explore and implement a series of financial facilitation measures for Hong Kong residents to access financial and banking services across the border in the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area (GBA), including a prospective, two-way wealth management connect scheme. Hong Kong maintains a firm foothold as the global hub for offshore renminbi business. According to the Bank for International Settlements (BIS) Triennial Survey of Foreign Exchange (FX) and Derivatives Market Turnover, Hong Kong continued to be the largest offshore renminbi FX centre in the world.

Continuous efforts were put into opening up new opportunities to further enhance the competitiveness of Hong Kong’s financial platform. To promote the development of the fund business in Hong Kong, the HKMA worked closely with the Government and industry to provide a more favourable tax and regulatory environment for fund formation. A number of large-scale events and targeted outreach activities were organised to promote Hong Kong as a hub for green finance, infrastructure investment and financing and corporate treasury centres (CTCs). In an effort to enhance Hong Kong’s soft power, the Hong Kong Academy of Finance (AoF) was set up in June to develop financial leadership and promote research collaboration.

In the central banking and regulatory community, the HKMA plays a leadership role in a number of regional and international committees. The HKMA chaired the Standing Committee on Supervisory and Regulatory Cooperation (SRC) of the Financial Stability Board (FSB) until 31 August 2019. Currently, the HKMA is chairing the Supervision and Implementation Group (SIG) of the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (Basel Committee), and the Working Group on Financial Markets (WGFM) established under the Executives’ Meeting of East Asia-Pacific Central Banks (EMEAP). The HKMA is also co-chairing the Non-Bank Monitoring Experts Group (NMEG) of the FSB with the US Securities and Exchange Commission.

The safe and efficient operation of Hong Kong’s financial infrastructure lays a solid foundation for Hong Kong’s role as an international financial centre. The four interbank Real Time Gross Settlement (RTGS) systems, the Central Moneymarkets Unit (CMU) and the Hong Kong Trade Repository (HKTR) achieved 100% system availability in 2019, beating the target of 99.95%. Through its accounts set up with the two Mainland central securities depositories, the CMU facilitates the settlement of transactions conducted under Bond Connect Northbound Trading and the holding of Mainland debt securities on behalf of relevant CMU members.

The FPS, which serves as an extension of Hong Kong dollar RTGS system to enable the public to make instant retail fund transfers and payments across different banks and stored value facilities (SVFs) on a round-the-clock basis, ran smoothly in its first year of operation. Users’ adoption of the facility had increased steadily, as manifested in the four million registrations and tripling of transaction volumes by the end of 2019. The FPS brings new opportunities to the retail payment industry and promotes fintech innovation.

To ensure the general safety and efficiency of the local retail payment industry, the HKMA has designated and is overseeing a total of six retail payment systems (RPSs) under the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance (PSSVFO). The HKMA also issued two new SVF licences in May, bringing the total number of SVF licensees to 18. SVF licensees continued to launch new products and services actively during the year to diversify customer choices and enhance user experience.

# REVIEW OF 2019

# Hong Kong as a Fintech Hub in Asia

# Smart Banking initiatives

The seven Smart Banking initiatives were announced by the HKMA in September 2017 with the aim of helping the banking sector achieve higher standards of operation and embrace the enormous opportunities brought about by the convergence of banking and technology. During the year, considerable progress was made in implementing these initiatives and transforming the fintech ecosystem of Hong Kong.

# Faster Payment System

The launch of the FPS in September 2018 was a major milestone in the financial infrastructure development of Hong Kong in the digital era. The FPS further promotes the adoption of e-payment in Hong Kong by providing efficient and convenient payment services to the general public and corporates. Since the launch of the FPS, the number of participating service providers had increased to 30 banks and 11 SVFs, with the addition of nine banks and one SVF, by the end of 2019.

Usage of the FPS has also grown steadily. As of 31 December 2019, the FPS recorded four million registrations (Chart 1) and processed 44 million transactions involving an aggregate amount of HK$748.5 billion and RMB17 billion. In December 2019, average daily turnover reached 168,000 transactions worth HK$2.4 billion and RMB38 million (Chart 2), as compared with 51,000 transactions during its first full month of operation in October 2018.

Faster payment System recorded: 
- 4 million registrations as of 31 December 2019
- 44 million transactions as of 31 December 2019
- 168,000 transactions worth HK$2.4 billion and RMB38 million of average daily turnover in December 2019

The HKMA works with the industry to extend FPS usage from person-to-person payments to bill payments and other merchant payments. For example, enhancements were made to enable merchants to use a variety of proxy identifiers and accept partial or over-payments via a QR code. A technical specification was developed to facilitate the invocation of a mobile banking or SVF e-wallet mobile application (app) from a business mobile app for FPS payment. This would greatly improve customer experience in making merchant and business payments via the FPS using mobile devices.

The HKMA also works closely with relevant Government departments to assist them in using the FPS to accept bill payments from the public. From 1 November, bills issued by the Inland Revenue Department, the Rating and Valuation Department and the Water Supplies Department were printed with an FPS QR code so that the public could scan the QR code easily with supporting mobile banking or SVF e-wallet apps to make payment. The HKMA will continue working with various Government departments and public bodies to explore other potential use cases which can make it convenient for the public to make payment via the FPS.

To raise public awareness of the FPS, the HKMA has developed a new series of education and publicity materials, such as Announcements in the public Interest for broadcast on television and radio, as well as videos and electronic banners for digital platforms. The HKMA also participated in trade fairs to promote the FPS to small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and corporates. Various FPS participating banks and SVFs launched promotion campaigns and offered incentives to encourage customers to register with the FPS and to use it for fund transfer and bill payment.

In addition, the HKMA engaged a number of industry organisations and institutions to provide briefings on the FPS so as to introduce its functionalities and the potential benefits it may bring to different businesses in collecting and making payment.

The Government has adopted FPS for bill payments on taxes, rates and Government rent and water charges.

# Open Application Programming Interface

The HKMA continued to facilitate the banking sector’s development and adoption of Open API in accordance with the four-phase approach of the Open API Framework. Under phase I, 20 retail banks opened up over 500 Open API endpoints in January, covering information of banking products and services. Under phase II, the banks opened up in October over 300 APIs to support applications for banking products and services.

# Research and talent development

On trade finance, a proof-of-concept (PoC) study on linking up eTradeConnect and we.trade was completed in the first quarter of the year. In November, a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) was signed between the subsidiaries of Hong Kong Interbank Clearing Limited and the Institute of Digital Currency of the People’s Bank of China (PBoC) to conduct a PoC study on linking up eTradeConnect and the PBoC Trade Finance platform to provide firms in both Hong Kong and Mainland China with more convenient trade finance services.

On Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC), the HKMA and the Bank of Thailand embarked on a joint research project named project Inthanon-LionRock to study the application of CBDC to cross-border payments, with a view to facilitating HKD-THB payment-versus-payment (pvp) among banks in Hong Kong and Thailand.

HKMA Executive Director (Financial Infrastructure), Mr Colin Pou (first from left), together with Director-General of the Institute of Digital Currency of the PBoC, Mr Mu Changchun (first from right), witness the signing ceremony of an MoU to conduct a PoC trial on linking up eTradeConnect and the PBoC Trade Finance Platform. The MoU is signed between Chief Executive Officer of the Hong Kong Trade Finance Platform Company Limited, Ms Haster Tang (second from left), and Deputy Director-General of the Institute of Digital Currency of the PBoC and Director of the Shenzhen Fintech Institute, Mr Di Gang (second from right).

On artificial intelligence (AI), the HKMA carried out a study on the application of AI technology in the Hong Kong banking industry. Key findings of an industry-wide AI survey were published in November, followed by the issuance of the full report, titled “Reshaping Banking with Artificial Intelligence”, in December.

The report “Reshaping Banking with Artificial Intelligence” is published in December.

A fact sheet is published to highlight the key facts and figures derived from a survey on the use of AI in the Hong Kong banking industry.

In an effort to enlarge the fintech talent pool, the HKMA continued to run the Fintech Career Accelerator Scheme 2.0 in collaboration with its strategic partners to nurture young talent at various stages of their career development. Over 220 students benefited from the programme last year.

zh:
# 國際金融中心

香港是一個世界各地具有競爭力的國際金融中心。落實智慧銀行措施已取得良好進展，以進一步推動香港作為金融科技樞紐。藉著利用內地金融市場開放所帶來嘅機遇，已作出大量進展以推動粵港澳大灣區的金融合作，尤其是在便利香港居民於該領域跨境使用金融和銀行服務方面。

同時，已作出大量努力，以開放新機遇進一步加強香港金融平台的競爭力，包括基礎設施投資融資、綠色金融及私人股權基金。香港金融學院已設立，以可持續的方式提升香港的軟實力。

在中央銀行及監管界別中，香港金融管理局在數目區域及國際委員會中發揮領導作用，這明確肯定了香港在國際工作方面的專業知識和承諾。

# 概覽

為加強香港作為亞洲金融科技中心的地位，香港金融管理局（HKMA）大力推動實施於2017年9月公布的七項智慧銀行措施，旨在促進銀行及支付行業內金融科技的發展與應用。這些措施在本年度的關鍵進展包括：

- 擴展更快支付系統（FpS）的應用；  
- 促進銀行業開放應用程式介面（open ApI）架構第一階段和第二階段（II）的落實；  
- 進一步提升金融科技研究與人才發展；  
- 加強金融科技領域的跨境合作；授予八間虛擬銀行牌照；  
- 促進業界日益增加地使用金融科技監管沙盒（FSS）2.0來推出金融科技計劃；以及  
- 透過「 Banking Made Easy 」計劃進一步促進監管科技（Regtech）的應用。

香港金融管理局金融科技促進辦公室（FFO）與香港金融管理局銀行部共同發揮推動落實這些計劃的關鍵作用。

香港在全球範圍內發揮不可或缺的作用，促進國際投資者配置人民幣資產，憑藉滬港通和債券通計劃，擁有無與倫比的內地市場準入渠道。 過去一年，債券通註冊投資者數目增長兩倍，每日成交額亦可見一斑。 債券通和滬港通進一步引入了多項優化措施，為國際投資者投資內地證券提供更多便利和靈活性。 香港金管局亦與內地當局緊密合作，探索和實施一系列金融便利措施，方便香港居民在粵港澳大灣區全方位地獲取金融和銀行服務，包括具前景的兩方式財富管理互聯互通計劃。 香港保持堅定不移的立足點，作為離岸人民幣業務的全球中心。 根據國際清算銀行（BIS）三年一次的《外匯及衍生品市場成交額調查》，香港繼續是全球最大的人民幣離岸外匯中心。

持續投入努力以開拓新機遇，進一步提升香港金融平台的競爭力。為推動香港的基金業務發展，香港金融管理局與政府及業界緊密合作，提供更為利好的稅務及監管環境，以促進基金設立。為推廣香港作為綠色金融、基礎設施投資與融資及企業財務中心（CTCs）的樞紐，舉辦了一系列大型活動及針對性宣傳推廣行動。為提升香港的軟實力，香港金融學院（AoF）於6月設立，以培育金融領導人才並推動研究合作。

在中央銀行及監管機構中，香港金管局在數目眾多的區域及國際委員會中發揮領導作用。香港金管局領導金融穩定理事會（FSB）的監管與合作常設委員會（SRC），直至2019年8月31日。現時，香港金管局擔任巴塞爾銀行監理委員會（Basel Committee）的監管與落實小組（SIG）主席，以及東亞及太平洋區中央銀行高級管理人員會議（EMEAP）下設立的金融市場工作小組（WGFM）主席。香港金管局亦與美國證券交易委員會共同擔任金融穩定理事會（FSB）的非銀行監測專家小組（NMEG）主席。

香港金融基礎設施的安全高效運作，為香港作為國際金融中心奠定了穩固的根基。四個銀行間即時全額結算系統（RTGS）、中央結算及交收系統（CMU）及香港儲存庫（HKTR）在2019年取得100%的系統可用率，超越了99.95%的目標。透過與兩家內地中央證券存管機構設立的賬戶，中央結算及交收系統協助進行北向債券通交易的結算，並代表相關會員持有內地債務證券。

轉數快作為港元即時支付系統的延伸，使公眾能全天候跨不同銀行及儲值設施（SVFs）進行即時零售資金轉帳及付款，其在首個運作年順暢。用戶對該設施的採用率持續增加，截至年底已達四百萬登記數目及交易量增長兩倍。轉數快為零售支付行業帶來新機遇，並推動金融科技創新。

為確保本地零售支付行業的整體安全及效率，金管局已指定並監察《支付系統及儲值設施條例》（PSSVFO）下的六個零售支付系統（RPS）。金管局亦於5月發出兩張新的儲值設施牌照，使儲值設施牌照持有人的數目增至18。儲值設施牌照持牌人於該年繼續推出新產品及服務，積極多元化客戶選擇，並提升使用者經驗。

# 檢討 2019

# 香港作為亞洲金融科技樞紐

# 智慧銀行創新方案

香港金管局於2017年9月公布了七項智慧銀行業倡議，旨在協助銀行業**取得****更高**的**運作**水平，並把握銀行與科技匯聚所帶來的**龐大****機遇**。在該**年**，在**實施**這些倡議和轉型香港的金融科技生態系統方面**作出**了**大量**的**進展**。

# 更快付款系統

2018年9月推出轉數快是香港在數碼時代金融基礎設施發展的里程碑。轉數快進一步推動香港採用電子支付，透過向公眾及企業提供高效及方便的支付服務。自轉數快推出以來，參與服務供應商的數目已增加至30間銀行及11間SVF，此外，新增了九間銀行及一間SVF，至2019年底。

轉數快的使用量亦穩定增長。截至2019年12月31日，轉數快記錄了首個四百萬登記數目（圖1），並處理了總額為港幣748.5億元及人民幣17億元的44百萬宗交易。12月，每日成交額達到168,000宗，價值港幣2.4億元及人民幣38百萬（圖2），相比其2018年10月首個十足運作每月，當時的交易宗數為51,000宗。

更快支付系統記錄：
- 2019年12月31日累計登記數目為4百萬
- 2019年12月31日累計交易數目為44百萬
- 2019年12月交易總額為HK$24億及人民幣38百萬，平均每日成交額為168,000筆

金管局與業界合作，將轉數快用量從人對人付款擴展至繳付法案及其他商戶付款。例如，作出了一些改進，使商戶可以利用不同類型的代理識別碼，並透過二維碼接受部分或過多的付款。制定了技術守則，以促進從商戶手機應用程式（app）調用流動銀行應用程式或 SVF 電子錢包手機應用程式（app），以便進行轉數快付款。這將大大改善客戶利用流動裝置透過轉數快進行商戶及商業付款的經驗。

香港金融管理局亦緊密與相關政府部門合作，協助他們利用轉數快接受公眾繳付帳單。由11月1日起，稅務局、評估及物業估價署和水務署發出的帳單均印有轉數快二維碼，以便公眾可容易地使用支持的流動銀行或SVF電子錢包應用程式掃描二維碼進行付款。香港金融管理局將繼續與各項政府部門和公營機構合作，探索其他潛在應用情況，以方便公眾透過轉數快繳費。

為提高公眾對轉數快的認識，香港金融管理局推出一系列新的教育及宣傳資料，例如在電視及電台播放的宣傳片，以及用於數碼平台的視頻及電子橫額。香港金融管理局亦參與博覽會，向中小企及企業推動轉數快。各項參與轉數快的銀行及支付通訊服務提供者推出推廣宣傳活動，並提供鼓勵措施，以鼓勵客戶註冊轉數快，並用轉數快進行資金轉賬及支付賬單。

此外，金管局委聘了多家業界組織和機構，提供關於轉數快簡報，以推出其功能，以及它可能為不同企業在收款和付款方面帶來的潛在福利。

政府已採用轉數快為稅款、差餉及地租和水費的繳費方式。

# 開放應用程式介面

香港金融管理局繼續根據開放API架構的四階段方法，促進銀行業發展及採用開放API。在第一階段，20間零售銀行於1月開立超過500個開放API端點，涵蓋銀行產品及服務的資訊。在第二階段，銀行於10月開立超過300個API，以支持銀行產品及服務的應用。

# 研究與人才發展

在貿易融資方面，將eTradeConnect與we.trade連接的《試驗》已落成於本《年》的《首個》《季度》。在《11月》，香港銀行同業結算有限公司的子公司與中國人民銀行數字貨幣研究所簽署《諒解備忘錄》，以《進行》一項《試驗》，將eTradeConnect與中國人民銀行貿易融資平台連接，為香港和中國內地的《市民》提供更《方便》的貿易融資服務。

關於中央銀行數字貨幣（CBDC），香港金融管理局與泰國央行開展了一項名為Inthanon-LionRock的聯合研究項目，研究CBDC在跨境支付中的應用，期望促進香港與泰國銀行之間的港元-泰銖支付對支付（PVP）當中。

香港金融管理局金融基礎設施執行總監彭志豪先生（左起首個），與中國人民銀行數字貨幣研究所所長穆長春先生（右起首個），一同見證簽署《諒解備忘錄》的簽署儀式，以進行將eTradeConnect與中國人民銀行貿易融資平台連接的試驗。該《諒解備忘錄》由香港貿易融資平台有限公司首席營運官唐慧星女士（左起第二個）與中國人民銀行數字貨幣研究所副所長兼深圳金融科技研究院院長狄剛先生（右起第二個）簽署。

關於人工（智能）(認可機構)，香港金融管理局進行了一項關於人工智能技術在香港銀行業應用範圍的調查。一份廣泛的認可機構調查發現刊登於11月，其十足的報告，題為「以人工（智能）重塑銀行業」，則於12月發布。

《以人工智能重塑银行业》報告於12月刊登。

一份事實簡報已刊登，以突出關鍵的事實和數字，這些數字和事實是從關於在香港銀行業使用認可機構的調查中得出的。

為擴大金融科技人才庫，香港金融管理局繼續運行與戰略伙伴合作的金融科技職業加速器計劃2.0，以培育不同職業階段的年輕人才。逾220名學生去年受惠於該計劃。

en:
# Reserves Management

Global financial markets performed better than expected in 2019 as the effect of accommodative monetary policies from major central banks outweighed concerns about the global growth slowdown and US-China trade tensions. Global equity markets rebounded following a significant correction in the fourth quarter of 2018, while major government bond yields declined and bond prices went up. Under such a favourable environment, the Exchange Fund recorded an investment income of HK$262.2 billion in 2019, representing an investment return of 6.6%.

# THE EXCHANGE FUND

The Exchange Fund’s primary objective, as laid down in the Exchange Fund Ordinance, is to affect, either directly or indirectly, the exchange value of the currency of Hong Kong. The Fund may also be used to maintain the stability and integrity of Hong Kong’s monetary and financial systems to help maintain Hong Kong as an international financial centre. The HKMA, under the delegated authority of the Financial Secretary (FS) and within the terms of the delegation, is responsible to the FS for the use and investment management of the Exchange Fund.

# MANAGEMENT OF THE EXCHANGE FUND

# Investment objectives and portfolio structure

The Exchange Fund Advisory Committee (EFAC) has set the following investment objectives for the Exchange Fund:

(a) to preserve capital;
(b) to ensure that the entire Monetary Base, at all times, is fully backed by highly liquid US dollar-denominated assets;
(c) to ensure that sufficient liquidity is available for the purposes of maintaining monetary and financial stability; and
(d) subject to (a)–(c), to achieve an investment return that will help preserve the long-term purchasing power of the Fund.

These objectives take full account of the statutory purposes of the Exchange Fund, and are incorporated into the portfolio structure and the target asset mix of the Fund.

Broadly speaking, the Exchange Fund has two major portfolios: the Backing Portfolio (BP) and the Investment Portfolio (IP). The BP holds highly liquid US dollar-denominated assets to provide full backing to the Monetary Base as required under Currency Board arrangements. The IP invests primarily in the bond and equity markets of the member countries of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development to preserve the value and long-term purchasing power of its assets.

To better manage risks and enhance returns in the medium and long term, the HKMA diversifies part of the Exchange Fund’s investments in a prudent and incremental manner into a wider variety of asset classes. This includes emerging market and Mainland bonds and equities, private equity (including infrastructure), and real estate. Emerging market and Mainland bonds and equities are held under the IP, while private equity and real estate investments are held under the Long-Term Growth Portfolio (LTGP). The cap for the market value of investments under the LTGP is set at the aggregate of one-third of the accumulated surplus of the Exchange Fund and the portion of the Future Fund and placements by subsidiaries of the Exchange Fund linked to the LTGP.

The Strategic Portfolio, established in 2007, holds shares in Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Limited that have been acquired by the Government for the account of the Exchange Fund for strategic purposes. This Portfolio is not included in the assessment of the Fund’s investment performance because of its unique nature.

# Placements with the Exchange Fund

The Exchange Fund, from time to time, accepts placements by fiscal reserves, Government funds and statutory bodies. The interest rate is generally linked to the performance of the IP, with the major exception of the Future Fund, which links its interest rate to both the IP and the LTGP with reference to the portfolio mix. As at the end of 2019, the portfolio mix of the Future Fund between the IP and the LTGP was about 40:60.

# The investment process

The investment process of the Exchange Fund is underpinned by decisions on two types of asset allocation: the strategic asset allocation and the tactical asset allocation. The strategic asset allocation, reflected in the investment benchmark, represents long-term asset allocation given the investment objectives of the Exchange Fund. Guided by the strategic allocation, assets are tactically allocated in an attempt to achieve an excess return over the benchmark. This means the actual allocation is often different from the benchmark (or strategic) allocation. The differences between the actual and benchmark allocations are known as “tactical deviations”. While the benchmark and tracking error limit are determined by the FS in consultation with the EFAC, tactical decisions and allowable ranges for tactical deviations are made and set by the HKMA under delegated authority. Within the ranges allowed for tactical deviations, portfolio managers may assume positions to take advantage of short-term market movements.

# Investment management

# Direct investment

The HKMA set up the Exchange Fund Investment Office (EFIO) in August 2018 to house its investment and related risk management functions. Staff members of the EFIO directly manage about 71% of the investments of the Exchange Fund, comprising the entire BP and part of the IP. This part of the IP includes a set of portfolios invested in global fixed-income markets and various derivative overlay portfolios implementing macro risk management strategies for the Fund.

# Use of external managers

In addition to managing assets internally, the HKMA employs external fund managers to manage about 29% of the Exchange Fund’s assets, including all its listed equity portfolios and other specialised asset classes. The purpose of engaging external managers is to tap the best investment expertise available in the market to realise sustainable returns, draw on diverse and complementary investment styles, and gain their market insights and technical expertise in investment.

Expenditure relating to the use of external managers includes fund management and custodian fees, transaction costs, and withholding and other taxes. The expenditure is determined primarily by market factors and may fluctuate from year to year.

# Risk management and compliance

The growing complexity of the investment environment underlines the importance of risk management. Stringent controls and investment guidelines are in place for both internally and externally managed portfolios, and compliance with guidelines and regulations is closely monitored. As the investment environment has become more complex, risk assessment has been strengthened to support the Exchange Fund’s increased level of investment diversification. Risk-control tools are deployed to assess market risks under both normal and adverse market conditions. Detailed performance attribution analyses are also conducted to identify sources of performance, enabling the HKMA to assess how to make the best use of the investment skills of both internal and external managers.

# Responsible investment

The HKMA is supportive of responsible investment (RI) by weaving environmental, social and governance (ESG) factors into the investment process for both public and private market investments of the Exchange Fund.

In terms of public market investments, the HKMA implements both process-related and investment-related measures. One process-related measure taken by the HKMA is the adoption of the Principles of Responsible Ownership (PRO) issued by the Securities and Futures Commission in 2016, which help investors determine how best to meet their ownership responsibilities in relation to their investments in Hong Kong-listed companies. In managing the Exchange Fund, the HKMA has developed internal guidelines on ESG factors covering the process of selection, appointment and monitoring of external fund managers. The appointed external fund managers for the HKMA’s Hong Kong equities and Mainland active equities portfolios are required to adhere to the pRO in managing the investments on a “comply-or-explain” basis, and external fund managers appointed to manage the HKMA’s portfolios in developed market equities need to adhere to internationally recognised ESG standards. Apart from externally managed funds, ESG factors are also incorporated into the credit risk analysis of the HKMA’s internally managed bond investment.

As for ESG investments in the public market, the HKMA has invested in green bonds since 2015 as one of the early investors in this market, and participates in the Managed Co-Lending Portfolio Programme, which is run by the International Finance Corporation with a focus on sustainable investments across emerging markets. Going forward, the HKMA will continue to grow its green bond portfolio by either direct investment or investing in green bond funds. The HKMA also plans to construct ESGthemed mandates in equities investment by adopting an ESG equities index as a benchmark for passive portfolios and engaging active equities managers who apply ESG factors in their investment decisions.

With respect to private market investments, the HKMA examines the ESG policies and practices of general partners as part of its due diligence process. In particular, ESG risk evaluation is conducted as a mandatory part of due diligence in all LTGP investments. For the LTGP, the HKMA invests in projects with sustainable features; for instance, the HKMA has invested in renewables since 2013 in direct and co-investments in the energy sector, as well as green buildings and warehouses with green and sustainable features in its real estate portfolio. Going forward, the HKMA will continue to source projects with sustainable features and include green accreditation as a predominant factor in real estate investment.

The HKMA will monitor the development of ESG standards closely and assess how these standards can be further integrated into its investment process. The process is facilitated by its collaboration with like-minded investors and relevant international organisations. In particular, being a signatory of the UN-supported principles for Responsible Investment, which is the world’s leading proponent of RI, the HKMA expects to participate in the formulation of ESG best practices and to motivate other investors in adopting RI. Besides, the HKMA is also a member of FCLTGlobal, a not-for-profit organisation that works to encourage a longer-term focus in business and investment decision-making through workshops and research studies. In 2019, the HKMA also became a supporter of the Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures.

For more details about the HKMA’s RI policy framework, see the Corporate Social Responsibility chapter.

# PERFORMANCE OF THE EXCHANGE FUND

# The financial markets in 2019

Despite concerns about the global growth slowdown and US-China trade tensions, global financial markets performed well in 2019 on the back of accommodative monetary policies from major central banks. Following a significant correction in the fourth quarter of 2018, global equity markets rallied in 2019. In the bond markets, major government bond yields declined markedly while bond prices went up in the first three quarters of 2019 as a result of monetary easing. Although bond prices retreated in the fourth quarter amid a slight rebound in yields, the overall gains in the bond markets were still satisfactory in 2019.

In the currency markets, major currencies performed differently against the US dollar. After declining by 3.8% in the third quarter due to an escalation of US-China trade tensions, the renminbi recovered part of its earlier losses in the fourth quarter given easing trade tensions. Overall, the renminbi depreciated by 1.4% against the US dollar. While the pound fell by 3.2% in the third quarter due to the heightened risk of a no-deal Brexit, it had since rebounded significantly as more clarity on Brexit emerged in the fourth quarter, eventually gaining 4.0% against the US dollar.

The performances of major currency, bond and equity markets in 2019 are shown in Table 1.

# The Exchange Fund’s performance

The Exchange Fund recorded an investment income of HK$262.2 billion in 2019. This comprised gains on bonds of HK$114.5 billion, gains on Hong Kong equities of HK$22.1 billion, gains on other equities of HK$100.7 billion, a negative currency translation effect of HK$13.0 billion on non-Hong Kong dollar assets, and gains of HK$37.9 billion on other investments held by the investment holding subsidiaries of the Fund. Separately, the Strategic portfolio recorded a valuation gain of HK$2.5 billion.

The total assets of the Exchange Fund reached HK$4,206.7 billion at the year end. The market value of investments under the LTGP totalled HK$335.1 billion, with private equity amounting to HK$233.4 billion and real estate at HK$101.7 billion. Outstanding investment commitments reached HK$219.3 billion.

The investment return of the Exchange Fund in 2019, excluding the Strategic portfolio, was 6.6%. Specifically, the IP achieved a rate of return of 9.7%, while the Bp gained 2.5%. The LTGP has recorded an annualised internal rate of return of 12.6% since its inception in 2009.

zh:
# 資產管理

全球金融市場在2019年表現 更好 於預期，因為主要央行的寬鬆貨幣政策的 生效 大於 對全球經濟放緩和 中美 摩擦 的擔憂。全球股票市場在2018年 第4季 的 重大 調整 後 反彈，而主要政府債券收益率 下跌 ，債券價格上漲。在如此 利好 的環境下，金管局 記錄 了2,622 億 港幣的投資收入，相當於 6.6% 的投資回報。

# 交易所基金

匯生銀行基金的目標，按照《匯生銀行基金條例》所制定，是直接或間接影響香港的貨幣匯率。基金亦可運用以維持香港貨幣及金融系統的穩定與健全，幫助維持香港作為國際金融中心的地位。金管局在財政司長的授權下，並在轉授的條款內，對匯生銀行基金的使用和投資管理負責於財政司長。

# 外匯基金管理

# 投資目標與投資組合架構

聯匯基金諮詢委員會（聯匯諮詢委員會）已為聯匯基金設立了以下投資目標：

(a) 保本；  
(b) 確保整個貨幣基礎在任何時候都由高度流動性的美元計價資產十足支持；  
(c) 確保有足夠的流動性，以維持貨幣和金融穩定；  
(d) 在符合(a)至(c)的前提下，取得投資回報，以幫助維持基金的長期購買力。

這些目標選持倉盤十足地考慮了交易基金的法定目的，並註冊於基金的投資組合架構和目標資產配置中。

大致上，外匯基金擁有兩大主要組合：支持組合（BP）及投資組合（IP）。支持組合持有高度流動性的美元計價資產，以根據貨幣發行局制度的規定，為貨幣基礎提供十足支持。投資組合主要投資於經濟合作及發展組織成員國的債券及股票市場，以保本並維持其資產的長線購買力。

為更好地管理風險並提升中長線回報，香港金管局以審慎且循序漸進的方式，將部分投資基金的資產分散至更廣的資產類別。這包括新興市場及內地債券和股票、私募股權（包括基礎設施）以及房地產。新興市場及內地的債券和股票在投資框架下進行，而私募股權和房地產投資則在長線增長投資組合（LTGP）下進行。長線增長投資組合（LTGP）下投資的市值上限，以投資基金累計盈餘的三分之一以及與長線增長投資組合掛鈎的未來基金及投資基金附屬機構的存款總和為上限。

策略投資組合於二零零七年設立，持有香港交易所及結算所有限公司的股份，該等股份由政府為外匯基金的策略性目的而購得。由於其獨特性質，此投資組合並未包括在基金投資表現的評估中。

# 投資於交易所基金

外匯基金不時接受財政儲備、政府基金及法定機構的存款。利率一般與投資組合表現掛鈎，但未來基金為重大例外，其利率則同時參考投資組合配置，與投資組合及長期增值基金掛鈎。截至2019年底，未來基金投資組合中投資組合及長期增值基金的配置比例約為40:60。

#投資流程

交易所基金的投資過程以兩類資產配置的決定為支持：策略性資產配置和戰略性資產配置。策略性資產配置反映在投資基準中，代表鑒於交易所基金的投資目標所作出的長線資產配置。以策略性配置作指引，資產會被戰略性分配，以爭取超越基準的超額回報。這表示實際配置往往不同於基準（或策略性）配置。實際配置與基準配置之間的差距稱為「戰略性偏離」。基準和追蹤錯誤上限由金管局與基金諮詢委員會共同決定，而戰略性決定以及戰略性偏離的允許範圍則由金管局在授權的當局下作出並設立。在允許的戰略性偏離範圍內，投資組合經理可以選持倉盤，以獲利於短期市場變化。

# 投資管理

# 直接投資

香港金融管理局（HKMA）於2018年8月設立了外匯基金投資辦公室（EFIO），以管理其投資及相關風險管理職能。EFIO的員工直接管理外匯基金約71%的投資，包括整個BP及IP的一部分。IP的這部分包括投資於全球定息市場的一系列投資組合，以及各項衍生工具疊加組合，用以實施為基金制定的宏觀風險管理策略。

# 使用外部管理人員

此外，除了內部管理資產外，香港金管局聘請外部基金經理管理約29日匯生基金的資產，包括其所有上市股本投資組合及其他專業資產類別。聘用外部經理的目的是爭取市場上可用的最佳投資專業知識，以實現可持續的回報，汲取多元且互補的投資風格，以及獲得他們在投資方面的市場洞察力和技術專業知識。

與使用外部經理相關的支出包括基金管理費及託管費用、交易成本以及扣繳及其他稅項。此支出主要由市場因素決定，並可能每年有所變動。

# 風險管理與合規

投資環境的增長複雜度強調了風險管理的重要性。嚴格的控制和投資指引已制定於內部和外部管理的投資組合，並且對遵守指引和法規的情況進行緊密監察。隨著投資環境成為更複雜，風險評估已加強以支持外匯基金增加的投資多元化程度。風險控制工具被部署以評估在正常和不利市場條件下的市場風險。詳細的績效歸因分析亦進行以物色績效來源，支持金管局評估如何制定最佳運用內部和外部經理的技巧。

# 負責任投資

香港金融管理局支持將環境、社會及管治因素併入交易所基金的公眾及私人市場投資。

就公開市場投資而言，金管局實施了流程相關及投資相關的措施。金管局採納的一項流程相關措施是採用證券及期貨事務監察委員會於2016年發佈的《責任投資原則》（PRO），這有助於投資者決定如何最佳滿足其與其在香港上市公司的投資相關的責任。在管理外匯基金方面，金管局已制定內部指引，涵蓋外部基金經理的甄選、委任和監察流程，以評估環境、社會及管治因素。獲委任管理金管局香港股票及內地主動股票投資組合的外部基金經理規定恪守《責任投資原則》，並以「遵守或解釋」的方式管理投資；而獲委任管理金管局於發達市場股票投資組合的外部基金經理則需要恪守國際公認的環境、社會及管治標準。除了外部管理的基金外，環境、社會及管治因素亦已註冊到金管局內部管理的債券投資的信用風險分析中。

至於公共市場的環境、社會及管治投資，香港金融管理局早於2015年便已投資於綠色債券，成為該市場最早的投資者之一，並參與由國際金融公司主導、重點關注新興市場可持續投資的共同貸款投資組合計劃。展望未來，香港金融管理局將繼續增長其綠色債券投資組合，或直接投資，或投資於綠色債券基金。香港金融管理局亦計劃在股權投資中構建以ESG為主題的授權，採納環境、社會及管治股權指數作為被動投資組合的基準，並聘用將環境、社會及管治因素應用於其投資決定的主動股權經理。

就私募市場投資方面而言，金管局在盡職審查過程中檢視普通合夥人的環境、社會及管治政策和實務。特別是，環境、社會及管治風險評估是所有長遠策略投資組合投資的強制性盡職審查部分。對於長遠策略投資組合，金管局投資具有可持續發展特點的項目；例如，自2013年起，金管局已直接及共同投資能源行業的可再生能源，以及其房地產投資組合中的綠色建築和具有綠色及可持續發展特點的倉庫。展望未來，金管局將繼續尋找具有可持續發展特點的項目，並將綠色認證納入房地產投資的重要因素。

香港金融管理局會緊密監察環境、社會及管治標準的發展，並評估這些標準如何能進一步融入其投資過程。此過程有賴其與理念相近的投資者及相關國際組織的合作。特別地，作為聯合國支持的責任投資原則的簽署方，而該原則是全球領先的責任投資倡議平台，香港金融管理局預期會參與制定環境、社會及管治的最佳實踐，並鼓勵其他投資者採納責任投資。此外，香港金融管理局亦為FCLTGlobal的成員，該組織為非牟利機構，透過研討會及研究工作，致力於鼓勵企業及投資決策中融入長遠觀點。2019年，香港金融管理局亦成為氣候相關財務披露任務小組的支持者。

為更多關於香港金管局的責任投資政策框架的細則，請見企業社會責任章節。

# 基金績效

# 2019年金融市場

儘管對全球經濟成長減速及中美貿易摩擦的擔憂，全球金融市場在2019年仍表現良好，這得益於主要央行寬鬆的貨幣政策。在2018年第4季經歷重大調整後，全球股市在2019年出現反彈。在債券市場方面，主要國家政府債券收益率顯著下跌，而債券價格在2019年首三個季度因貨幣寬鬆而上漲。儘管第4季債券價格因收益率略為反彈而回落，但債券市場整體表現仍屬滿意。

在貨幣市場中，重大貨幣對美元的表現各異。在較早前的第三季度，由於美中貿易摩擦升溫，人民幣下跌了 3.8%，但在第四季度鑒於貿易摩擦緩和，人民幣反彈了部分之前的損失。整體而言，人民幣對美元貶值了 1.4%。雖然英鎊在第三季度因脫歐無協議的風險增加而下跌了 3.2%，但自此大幅反彈，隨著第四季度脫歐情況明朗化，最終增強了 4.0% 的美元價值。

二零一九年主要貨幣、債券和股票市場的表現見表一。

# 外匯基金的表現

金管局在2019年記錄了HK$2,622億的投資收益。此收益包括債券收益HK$1,145億、香港股票收益HK$221億、其他股票收益HK$1,007億、非港元資產的負匯率影響HK$130億，以及基金投資持倉子公司持有的其他投資收益HK$379億。另一方面，戰略投資組合記錄了HK$2.5%的評值收益。

交易所基金的總資產在年底達到4,206.7億港元。長期資產管理計劃（LTGP）下的投資總值為335.1億港元，其中私人股權為233.4億港元，不動產為101.7億港元。未償還的投資承諾達到219.3億港元。

2019年，聯匯基金（不包括策略投資組合）的投資回報為6.6%。具體而言，IP 取得 9.7% 的回報率，而 Bp 則增長了 2.5%。自 2009 年成立以來，LTGP 記錄了年化內部回報率為 12.6%。

# Corporate Functions

The HKMA maintains effective communication with the community and the market through the traditional media, social media platforms, its website, the Information Centre and various other channels to facilitate public understanding about its policies and operations. Within the institution, conscientious efforts are made to improve the HKMA’s corporate governance by supporting the professional development of staff, instituting rigorous financial discipline, enhancing information technology security, and promoting a culture of innovation to cope with challenges arising from the implementation of new initiatives and the increasing complexity of work.

# ENGAGING THE COMMUNITY

# Media relations and social media

The HKMA works closely with the media to enhance transparency and promote public understanding about its policies and work. During the year, 125 open press events were held, comprising 10 press conferences, 12 stand-up interviews and 103 other public functions. A further 25 media interviews were arranged. A total of 466 bilingual press releases were issued and a large number of media enquiries were handled every day.

To raise awareness of the HKMA’s key functions, the HKMA organised media briefings and educational workshops for local and overseas media as well as key opinion leaders in the community to facilitate understanding on a wide range of topics, such as the Linked Exchange Rate System (LERS), virtual banking, green finance, and Hong Kong as a competitive international financial centre.

Since July 2018, the HKMA has launched various social media channels to strengthen public education and communication. Five social media channels are currently in operation: Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter and YouTube, reaching out to a total of over 45,000 followers as at end-December 2019. Amid the social incidents in the second half of 2019, the HKMA made use of social media to rebut unfounded rumours regarding banking operations and financial stability, a move which proved to be highly effective in disseminating facts and preventing the rumours from spreading further.

# Public enquiries

The Public Enquiry Service provides an effective means for the public to better understand the key functions and operations of the HKMA. A total of 9,742 enquiries were handled in 2019, about half of which were related to banking policies and regulations, consumer banking, and notes and coins. Some of the notable enquiries raised were about the Coin Collection programme, banking products and services, banking-related guidelines and circulars, the Faster Payment System (FPS), and monetary and economic statistics.

Chart 1 shows the number of public enquiries received since 2016 and Chart 2 provides a breakdown by enquiry nature in 2019.

HKMA Chief Executive, Mr Eddie Yue, speaks at the Hong Kong Association of Banks Distinguished Speaker Luncheon.

HKMA Chief Executive, Mr Eddie Yue (left), and HKMA's then Chief Executive, Mr Norman Chan, meet with media after the announcement of the appointment of Mr Eddie Yue as the next Chief Executive of the HKMA.

# Publications

Apart from the HKMA Annual Report, in 2019 the HKMA published two issues of the Half-Yearly Monetary and Financial Stability Report, four issues of the Quarterly Bulletin, and regular updates of the Monthly Statistical Bulletin to provide up-to-date and thematic information and analyses on monetary, banking and economic issues in Hong Kong. In addition, the HKMA published 19 inSight articles, covering various topics related to its work. The inSight articles provide a useful channel for the HKMA to elucidate the rationale behind its major new initiatives or policies, and provide timely response to topical issues which are of interest to the public.

# HKMA website

The HKMA official website (www.hkma.gov.hk) presents more than 40,000 pages of content in English and traditional and simplified Chinese, and is the public access gateway to up-to-date information about the HKMA. It also contains the register of authorized institutions (AIs) and local representative offices and the register of the securities staff of AIs, both maintained under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance, as well as the register of stored value facility (SVF) licensees under the payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance. The HKMA official website underwent a major revamp and was relaunched in September with a new design layout, enriched content, an enhanced navigation structure, and more convenient search functions. The revamped website enables users to search information more easily and conveniently based on their own preferences. In particular, the revamped website carries a new section on “Smart Consumers”, where the public can find useful information and smart tips on a wide range of banking and related products or services. This is in line with the HKMA’s long-standing efforts to promote “smart and responsible” use of banking services.

The HKMA launches its revamped website.

The revamped HKMA website carries a new section on “Smart Consumers”.

The HKMA has been opening up financial data and important information published on its website via Open Application Programming Interface (Open API) by phases since 2018. By 2019, the HKMA has opened up 130 sets of Open ApIs on the HKMA’s website as originally planned. The HKMA embraces the development and application of Open API.

# HKMA Information Centre

The HKMA Information Centre on the 55th floor of Two International Finance Centre is an important resource introducing the work of the HKMA to the community and promoting public awareness of monetary and banking matters. It consists of an exhibition area and a library, and is open to the public six days a week. The exhibition area describes the HKMA’s work and the development of money and banking in Hong Kong. It also contains reading materials and exhibits for the study of Hong Kong’s monetary, banking and financial affairs.

The HKMA completed the last phase of revamp of its Information Centre — the Historical Timeline — during the year. The revamped Historical Timeline, featuring multimedia and digital display panels for visitors to review the major monetary and financial events in Hong Kong and globally in a more interactive manner, was re-opened to the public in October.

The first section of the Historical Timeline is made up of a multimedia display panel presenting major events from 1842 to 1993.

The second section of the Historical Timeline is a digital display panel presenting major events from 1993, when the HKMA was established, to the present.

The Information Centre organises guided tours for visitors. During the year, it received more than 48,000 visitors and hosted over 480 guided tours for schools and other groups (Chart 3). More than 753,000 people have visited the Information Centre since it opened in December 2003.

Guided tours of the Information Centre are organised for schools and other group visitors.

The library, situated next to the exhibition area, houses more than 26,000 books, journals and other publications for the study of Hong Kong’s monetary, banking and financial affairs and central banking topics. It also maintains the register of AIs and local representative offices and the register of securities staff of AIs, as required by section 20 of the Banking Ordinance.

# Public and consumer education

To reach out to the community and raise public awareness of the HKMA’s work, the HKMA organised a public education seminar for over 400 secondary school students and teachers in 2019. Topics covered in the seminar included an introduction to the work of the HKMA, Hong Kong’s banknotes, the FPS, SVFs, fintech and the Deposit Protection Scheme. More than 60,000 teachers and students have participated in this programme since its launch in 1998.

Students and teachers from secondary schools in different districts attend the 2019 public education seminar.

The focus of the HKMA’s consumer education initiatives during the year was on educating the public to protect their “personal digital keys”, a concept introduced to help the public visualise the significance of safeguarding information for accessing their online accounts. The central message was that in the digital world, account login details and personal information related to internet banking and other digital financial services were as important as the keys to their home, and should be well protected. Extensive promotion was arranged across different media, including the TV, radio, mobile applications, social media, and other digital and out-of-home platforms, to highlight smart tips on how to protect personal digital keys.

The Flagship Campaign on Personal Digital Keys is conducted via extensive cross-media promotion.

Sustained initiatives were also carried out to educate the public to be smart and responsible financial consumers. For example, members of the public were urged to stay vigilant of bogus phone calls purportedly from banks, and of investment scams promoted on social media. Issues to note when handling personal credit products, in particular personal loans taken out during the tax season, were also promoted.

To enhance financial literacy among secondary school students, the HKMA co-organised the “Hong Kong Liberal Studies Financial Literacy Championship” with various stakeholders for the fifth year. Infographics were newly used in the Championship this year to help students better understand sophisticated financial concepts. An online quiz was conducted, attracting 10,450 submissions and culminating in the grand final competition, which was held at the HKMA for the first time. 

The Championship, attracting over 10,000 online submissions, ends with a live competition at the HKMA.

During the year, the HKMA kicked off the Second phase of its Cross-generation Outreach Educational programme, which was organised jointly with an education institution. The programme comprised bank simulation games, parents’ talks and train-the-trainer workshops, targeting kindergarten pupils, their parents and teachers, as well as young adults. Other initiatives on youth education included producing comic storybooks for primary school students and parents jointly with a professional association, as well as delivering talks to tertiary school students.

The HKMA continued to support the Investor and Financial Education Council in promoting financial literacy and capacity in Hong Kong, and will explore further collaboration with different stakeholders to maximise the impact of consumer education.

The Achievement Ceremony for the First Phase of the Crossgeneration Outreach Programme is held alongside the launch of the Second Phase.

Kindergarten pupils participate in the bank simulation game.

Comic storybooks are produced jointly with a professional association to disseminate smart tips on using banking and financial services to primary school students and their parents.

# OUR PEOPLE

While the HKMA is an integral part of the Government, it employs staff on terms different from those of the civil service to attract people with the right experience and expertise. The HKMA recruits, develops and maintains a highly professional workforce to support its policy objectives and respond flexibly to changing work priorities.

The establishment of the HKMA in 2019 was 1,005. During the year, the HKMA conducted a cross-departmental re-engineering exercise to enhance the efficiency of various work processes and redeploy existing resources to support new initiatives. As a result of this rigorous exercise, the overall establishment of the HKMA in 2020 remains unchanged at 1,005. Resources have been redeployed to undertake the following new tasks:

# Banking and Financial Stability
- Develop and implement a supervisory regime for virtual banks and cope with the increasingly complex prudential supervision standards
- Enhance supervisory capacity for the new regulatory regime for insurance intermediaries
- Step up ongoing monitoring of banks’ culture reform, and conduct ongoing supervision of banks and other relevant entities providing trust services

# Reserves Management
- Strengthen investment and risk management and other necessary support for the further expansion and diversification of the Exchange Fund’s investment activities

# Hong Kong as an International Financial Centre
- Support reforms that enhance the international competitiveness of Hong Kong’s tax regime regarding different financial services sectors
- Enhance the daily qualitative market surveillance and analyses of Trade Repository data

Table 1 gives a breakdown of the establishment and strength of the HKMA.

# Remuneration policies and pay review mechanism

The Financial Secretary (FS) determines the pay and conditions of service for HKMA staff on the advice of the Governance Sub-Committee (GSC) through the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee (EFAC), taking into account the prevailing market rates and practices. Remuneration comprises a total cash package and a provident fund scheme, with minimal benefits in kind. the cash package consists of monthly fixed pay (or basic pay) and variable pay that may be awarded to individual staff members as a lump sum once a year, depending on performance.

Pay for HKMA staff is reviewed annually by the FS in the light of recommendations made to him by the GSC through the eFAC, taking into account the GSC’s assessment of the performance of the HKMA in the preceding year, the pay-survey findings of the financial sector conducted by independent human resources consultants, and any other relevant factors. Special pay adjustments may be made from time to time to reward individual meritorious staff members and to maintain the competitiveness of their pay.

zh:
# 企業職能

香港金融管理局透過傳統媒體、社交媒體平台、其網站、資訊中心及各項其他渠道，與社區及市場保持有效溝通，以促進公眾對其政策及營運的了解。在機構內，作出認真努力以改善公司治理，包括支持員工專業發展、訂立嚴格的財務紀律、提升資訊科技安全，以及推動創新文化，以應對因落實新措施及工作複雜度增加而帶來的挑戰。

# 紹聘社區

# 媒體關係與社交媒體

香港金融管理局與媒體緊密工作，以提升透明度並推動公眾對其政策及工作之了解。本年共舉辦125場開放記者會，包括10場會議、12場即場訪問及103場其他公開活動。另安排25場媒體訪問。共發佈466份雙語新聞稿，每 日處理大量媒體查詢。

為提高公眾對香港金融管理局主要職能的認識，香港金融管理局舉辦了針對本地及海外媒體以及社區內關鍵意見領袖的媒體簡介會及教育研討會，以促進對掛鈎匯率制度（LERS）、虛擬銀行、綠色金融及香港作為一個競爭力強的國際金融中心等廣泛主題的了解。

自2018年7月以來，香港金融管理局已推出各項社交媒體渠道，以加強公眾教育和溝通。現時共有5個社交媒體渠道正在運作：Facebook、Instagram、LinkedIn、Twitter及YouTube，截至2019年12月底，總共有超過45,000名用戶。在2019年第二半年的社會事件之下，香港金融管理局利用社交媒體反駁有關銀行營運及金融穩定的不實謠言，此舉證明在傳播事實及防止謠言進一步散播方面高度有效。

# 公共查詢

公共查詢服務提供了一個有效的方式，讓公眾更好地了解金管局的主要職能和營運。 2019 年共處理了 9,742 宗查詢，其中約一半與銀行政策和法規、消費銀行以及紙幣和硬幣相關。 一些顯著的查詢涉及金幣收藏計劃、銀行產品及服務、銀行相關指引和通函、快速支付系統 (FpS) 以及貨幣和經濟統計。

圖 1 顯示自 2016年 接獲的公眾查詢數目，而圖 2 提供 2019 年按查詢性質的分類。

香港按揭證券有限公司執行總裁葉國華先生在香港銀行團體傑出講者午宴上致詞。

香港金融管理局執行總裁葉國華先生（左），以及當時香港金融管理局的執行總裁陳德霖先生，在公布葉國華先生接任香港金融管理局之後執行總裁的任命後，與媒體會見。

# 研究報告

除了香港金融管理局年度報告外，2019年香港金融管理局亦刊登了兩份半年度貨幣及金融穩定報告、四份季度通訊及定期更新的月度統計通訊，以提供有關香港貨幣、銀行及經濟事宜的最新資料及主題分析。此外，香港金融管理局亦刊登了19篇inSight文章，涵蓋與其工作相關的各項主題。inSight文章為香港金融管理局提供一個有用的渠道，以闡釋其重大新舉措或政策的理據，並對公眾關注的時事問題作出適時回應。

# 香港金管局網站

金管局官方網站（www.hkma.gov.hk）提供超過4萬頁的內容，以英文、傳統及簡體中文呈現，是公眾獲取金管局最新資訊的門戶。網站亦包含根據《銀行條例》第20條維護的獲授權機構（AIs）及本地代表辦事處的紀錄冊，以及獲授權機構的證券人員紀錄冊，以及根據《支付系統及儲值易設施條例》維護的儲值易設施（SVF）牌照持有人的紀錄冊。金管局官方網站經歷一向的重大改進，並於9月推出新設計佈局、豐富的內容、加強的導航結構及更方便的搜尋功能。改進後的網站使用戶更容易、更方便地根據自己的偏好搜尋資訊。特別是，改進後的網站設有「明智消費者」的新版塊，公眾可以在此找到涵蓋廣泛的銀行及相關產品或服務的有用資訊及明智提示。這符合金管局一向的努力，以推動「明智及負責任」地使用銀行服務。

金管局推出全新網站。

翻新後的香港金融管理局網站新增了一個名為「聰明消費者」的專欄。

香港金融管理局（HKMA）自2018年起，透過開放應用程式介面（Open API），分階段開立其網站上刊登的財務數據及重要資訊。至2019年，香港金融管理局（HKMA）已按原計劃在其網站上開立130套Open APIs。香港金融管理局（HKMA）支持開放應用程式介面（Open API）的發展與應用。

# 香港金融管理局資訊中心

香港金融管理局資訊中心位於兩國際金融中心55樓，是向社區引入香港金融管理局工作，並推動公眾對貨幣及銀行事務認識的重要資源。資訊中心包括展覽領域及圖書館，並對公眾開放六天。展覽領域描述香港金融管理局的工作，以及香港貨幣和銀行的發展歷程。展覽領域亦包含閱讀材料和展品，以研究香港的貨幣、銀行和金融事務。

香港金融管理局於本年已落成資訊中心翻新工程的最後階段—歷史時間軸。翻新的歷史時間軸主題為多媒體和數碼顯示屏，讓訪問學者以更互動的方式檢討香港及世界各地重大的貨幣和金融事件，並於10月重新開立。

歷史時間軸的首個部分由一個多媒體顯示面板組成，介紹1842年至1993年間的重大事件。

歷史時間軸的第二部分是一個數字顯示板，介紹從1993年香港金融管理局設立至今的重大事件。

資訊中心為訪問學者舉辦導賞服務。在過去一年，中心接獲超過48,000名訪問學者，並為學校及其他團體舉辦超過480場導賞服務（圖3）。自2003年12月資訊中心設立以來，已有超過753,000名市民參觀了資訊中心。

以導賞服務形式舉辦資訊中心的參觀活動，供學校及其他團體訪問學者使用。

圖書館毗鄰展覽領域，藏有超過26日書籍、期刊及其他研究報告，供研究香港貨幣、銀行及金融事務和中央銀行主題之用。它亦保持人工智能及本地代表辦事處的紀錄冊，以及根據銀行條例第20條規定的人工智能的證券人員紀錄冊。

#公眾及消費者教育

為向社會宣傳及提高公眾對金管局工作的認識，金管局於一九九八年推出一項計劃，自此便舉辦了多個公眾教育研討會，邀請超過四○○名中學學生及教師參與。研討會的 主題 涵蓋了金管局的工作 介紹、香港的紙幣、 轉數快 、虛擬銀行發牌、金融科技及存款保障計劃。 至今已有超過六成 的教師及學生 參與了此計劃。

學生和教師來自不同區的各級中學參加了2019年公共教育研討會。

香港金管局的消費者教育倡議活動的重點，在於教育公眾保護他們的“個人數字密碼”，這是一個引入的概念，旨在幫助公眾可視化保障資訊以使用其網上戶口的重要性。 核心訊息是，在數字全球，與網上銀行和其他數字金融服務相關的戶口登入細則和個人資訊，與保護自己住宅的鑰匙一樣重要，應得到良好保障。 為了強調保護個人數字密碼的智慧提示，在不同媒體上安排了廣泛的推廣，包括電視、收音機、手機應用程式、社交媒體以及其他數字和戶外平台。

旗艦個人數位金鑰推廣活動透過廣泛的跨媒體進行。

持續的倡議亦已展開，以教育公眾成為精明且負責任的金融消費者。例如，敦促公眾保持警覺，提防冒充銀行來電的詐騙電話，以及在媒體上宣傳的投資詐騙。關於處理個人信貸產品時需要發出的附註，特別是報稅期間辦理的個人貸款，亦已廣泛宣傳。

為提升中學生當中的財務素養，香港金管局與各項持份者共同舉辦「香港通識教育財務素養錦標賽」，今年已是第五年。今年賽事首次運用資訊圖表，幫助學生更好了解複雜的財務概念。一個網上測驗進行，吸引10,450份參與，最終進入決賽，並首個於香港金管局舉辦。

冠軍賽吸引了超過一萬份網上報名，最後將在香港會議展覽中心舉行現場比賽。

在該年，香港金融管理局展開了其跨代別推廣教育計劃的第二階段，該計劃與一所教育機構聯合舉辦。計劃包括銀行模擬遊戲、家長研討會及培訓講師工作坊，目標對象為幼稚園學生、他們的家長和教師，以及年青人。其他年青人教育的舉措包括與一間專業團體聯合製作小學學生和家長的漫畫故事書，以及向大專學生提供研討會。

香港金融管理局繼續支持投資者及財務教育委員會推動香港的財務素養及能力，並將探索與不同持份者進一步合作，以最大化消費者教育的影響。

跨世代接觸計劃首個階段的成就發布會將與第二階段的推出一同舉辦。

幼稚園學生參與銀行模擬遊戲。

漫畫故事書由專業團體聯合製作，以散佈利用銀行及金融服務的智慧建議給首要學校學生及其家長。

# 我們的市民

雖然香港貨幣管理局是政府的重要部分，但其聘請的員工所訂立的條款與文職人員不同，以吸引具備適當經驗及專業知識的市民。香港貨幣管理局招募、培訓及保持一支高度專業的工作人員隊伍，以支持其政策目標，並靈活回應變動的工作優先事項。

2019年香港金融管理局的設立為1,005。當年，香港金融管理局進行了一項跨部門的再造行動，以提升各項工作流程的效率，並重新調配現有資源以支持新任務。由於這項嚴格的行動，香港金融管理局2020年的整體設立保持不變，仍為1,005。資源已重新調配以執行隨着設立的新任務。

# 銀行及金融穩定性
- 制定及實施針對虛擬銀行的監管制度，並應對日益複雜的審慎監管標準。
- 提升針對保險中介人新監管制度的監管能力。
- 加強持續監控銀行文化改革，並對銀行及其他提供信託服務的相關實體進行持續監管。

# 儲備管理
- 加強投資及風險管理及其他必要支持，以促進交易所基金投資活動的進一步增長和多元化。

香港作為國際金融中心
- 支持改革，提升香港稅制在不同金融服務領域的競爭力，有關其國際競爭力。
- 提升貿易倉儲數據的每日定性市場監察及分析。

表一列出了香港金管局的設立和實力細節。

# 薪酬政策與薪酬檢討機制

財政司司長（FS）根據治理小組委員會（GSC）透過匯率基金諮詢委員會（EFAC）的意見，考慮現行市場薪酬水平及慣例，決定香港金管局（HKMA）員工的薪酬及服務條件。薪酬包括總現金方案及公積金計劃，福利方面則基本。現金方案包括每月固定薪酬（或基本薪酬）及浮動薪酬，該浮動薪酬可能根據表現，每年以合共形式頒發給個別職員。

香港金融管理局員工薪酬每年由金融服務事務委員會根據香港特別行政區政府人事委員會透過eFAC作出的建議進行檢視，並考量香港特別行政區政府人事委員會對香港金融管理局前一年表現的評估、由獨立人力資源顧問進行的金融業薪酬調查的發現，以及任何其他相關因素。有需要時，可不時作出特別薪酬調整，以獎勵個別表現優異的員工，並維持其薪酬的競爭力。

# Corporate Social Responsibility

The HKMA is committed to fulfilling its corporate social responsibility, and aims to be a responsible and sustainable organisation. This commitment is manifested in various areas, including promoting a sustainable and environment-friendly marketplace, supporting the wider community, protecting the environment and nurturing a caring workplace.

# MARKETPLACE

# Green and sustainable banking

Climate change is one of the major risks threatening the well-being of mankind and the sustainability of the world economy. The financial sector in which banks operate, being an integral part of the society, will also be impacted and hence should be more proactive in managing climate risks. The HKMA is committed to exploring ways to address this challenge. Against this background, the HKMA unveiled in May a number of measures for promoting the development of green finance in Hong Kong, including the adoption of a three-phased approach to promote green and sustainable banking.

# Responsible investment

As the investment manager of the Exchange Fund, the HKMA believes that the concept of responsible investment (RI) is highly relevant to its investment work. As the HKMA is one of the world’s largest asset owners, it will have a major impact on how fund managers pick assets.

# Our Beliefs

The HKMA sees RI as an investment approach that takes into account the impact of various environmental, social and governance (ESG) factors on long-term investment returns and their sustainability. The HKMA believes that, by putting an appropriate emphasis on RI and sustainable long-term economic performance, it can better achieve the investment objectives of the Exchange Fund and reduce risks associated with the ESG-related matters of its underlying investments.

# Our Principles

The HKMA’s guiding principle is that priority will generally be given to ESG investments if the long-term risk-adjusted return is comparable with other investments. Where appropriate, the HKMA adopts in its investment process the following RI principles that underpin its beliefs as a responsible long-term investor:

# Integration

The HKMA incorporates ESG factors into its investment analysis processes to identify risks and opportunities, as it believes that these factors can materially affect the long-term value of its investments. Specifically, the HKMA has been integrating ESG factors into its investment process for both public and private market investments. For public market investments, the HKMA incorporates ESG factors in its credit risk analysis of bond investment. External managers that share the HKMA’s RI beliefs are selected and appointed. The HKMA communicates its RI beliefs to all its external managers and expects them to align in such a way that the overall sustainable long-term economic performance target is attainable. For private market investments, the ESG policies and practices of the HKMA’s general partners are examined as part of its due diligence process.

# Active ownership

The HKMA exercises shareholder rights in its public equity holding in a manner that helps safeguard the long-term value of its investments. The HKMA believes that responsible corporate behaviour guided by ESG factors will help create shareholder value in the long term. The HKMA’s asset managers are expected to help the HKMA discharge its ownership responsibilities in the underlying investments by adopting active ownership through exercising voting rights and engaging with the corporates concerned.

# Collaboration

The HKMA seeks to join hands with like-minded investors and regulators to promote good practices for the long-term management of investments. It participates in and speaks at public events to share views and encourage the investment community to adopt RI.

See the Reserves Management chapter for more details about the HKMA’s work on RI during the year.

# Promoting financial inclusion

The HKMA attaches great importance to financial inclusion and has been making significant effort in promoting access to basic banking services by different segments of the society to meet the basic daily needs of the general public and the operational needs of legitimate businesses. In particular, the HKMA has been working closely with the banking industry on the following priority areas:

- Encouraging banks to launch more physical banking facilities and develop digital and innovative channels for the delivery of basic banking services to serve the general public, particularly residents of remote areas and public housing estates, and the elderly;

- Facilitating and monitoring the accessibility of bank accounts to individuals and small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs);

- Enhancing the accessibility of banking services to specific customer groups, for example, customers with disabilities and ethnic minorities;

- Facilitating and monitoring the accessibility of bank credit to SMEs; and

- Granting authorization to eight virtual banks, which will play an active role in promoting financial inclusion in delivering their banking services.

# COMMUNITY

# Promoting financial literacy

The HKMA promotes financial literacy through various channels. Apart from running educational programmes to promote smart and responsible use of banking and financial services by the public, the HKMA features on its revamped official website a new dedicated section on “Smart Consumers”, where the public can find useful information and smart tips on a wide range of banking and related products and services. Social media platforms such as Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, Instagram and Twitter are used in addition to the HKMA official website and publications to provide up-to-date information on banking and financial affairs.

The HKMA Information Centre, serving as the HKMA’s major public education and research resource since 2003, introduces the work of the HKMA to the community and promotes public awareness of monetary and banking matters. Educational guided tours are offered daily for group visitors from schools and non-profit making organisations. public education seminars and other activities are also organised for students to enhance their financial knowledge and literacy. In addition, the HKMA works closely with the Investor and Financial Education Council to promote financial literacy in Hong Kong via its financial education platform, The Chin Family.

See the Corporate Functions chapter for more details about the HKMA’s work on promoting financial literacy during the year. See the Banking Stability chapter for more details about the HKMA’s work on promoting financial inclusion during the year.

# Addressing the needs of special groups 

# Accessibility of Hong Kong banknotes

The 2018 Series of Banknotes retains accessibility features used in the previous series of banknotes to help the visually impaired differentiate between the denominations. These accessibility features include Braille, tactile lines and high-tactility numerals.

To help the visually impaired differentiate between the denomination of the banknotes, a mobile app, sponsored by the HKMA and developed by the Hong Kong Society for the Blind, uses the phone’s camera to scan the banknote patterns for the denomination. The app is available for download from Apple App Store and Google play Store for free. A note-measuring template sponsored by the HKMA and the three note-issuing banks has also been introduced to measure the length of the note. It can measure both the 2018 Series and the notes currently in circulation. The template is embossed with Braille on one side and symbols on the other. It is freely distributed at voluntary agencies serving the visually impaired community.

# Coin Collection Programme

Under the Coin Collection programme, the HKMA collaborates with the Hong Kong Council of Social Service to deploy the Coin Carts to collect coins on flag days for non-governmental organisations.

# Accessibility of public information

The revamped HKMA official website was launched in September. The revamped website has enhanced navigation structure to facilitate easy and convenient search by users based on their own preferences. In particular, the website contains a dedicated webpage “Information in Other Languages” under the “Smart Consumers” section, which provides useful information on banking services in seven languages commonly used by the ethnic minority community, namely Bahasa Indonesia, Hindi, Nepali, Punjabi, Tagalog, Thai and Urdu.

The HKMA is committed to ensuring that its website conforms to the maximum extent possible to the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0 Level AA standard, to facilitate barrier-free access to its online information by people with special needs.

# volunteer and charitable activities

The HKMA supports community services by taking part in volunteer and charitable activities. The Senior Citizen Home Safety Association awarded the Community Engagement Crystal Award to the HKMA for participating in the 2018 Love & Peace of Mind Corporate Engagement Programme.

Charitable events participated in by the HKMA Volunteer Team in 2019

“Yo! Let’s Walk the Road” by the Youth Outreach.

Artists and representatives from the social enterprise, Arts with the Disabled Association Hong Kong, visit the HKMA office, where its artworks are displayed.

HKMA staff members take part actively in Blood Donation Day, Territory-Wide Flag Day, Community Chest’s Green Day, Love Teeth Day, Skip Lunch Day, Dress Casual Day and regular campaigns that collect clothes, toys and other reusable items for donation to charities.

HKMA staff members take part actively in Blood Donation Day, organised by the Hong Kong Red Cross.

# Caring organisation

In recognition of its commitment to care for the community, the HKMA was accredited with the “10 Years Plus Caring Organisation Logo” by the Hong Kong Council of Social Service for the 13th consecutive year.

# ENVIRONMENT

# Green office measures

The HKMA has an established environmental policy to protect and preserve the environment. The policy and implementation measures are promulgated among its staff regularly. Green office measures include:

# Paper/Photocopying/Printing

- Encouraging the use of recycled paper and envelopes;
Distributing electronic copies instead of hard copies of documents;
- printing on both sides of the paper;
- Using colour printing and copying only when necessary;
- Avoiding the use of paper cups; and 
- Using environmentally friendly paper and ink for the HKMA’s Annual Report.

# Electricity

- Switching off PCs, printers, lights, audio-visual systems and other electrical appliances when these devices are not in use. Reactivating the preset power-saving mode installed in most equipment, such as water dispensers, electric punching machines and shredders, after use outside their preset operating hours; and 
- Reviewing regularly the need for additional air-conditioning beyond normal business hours.

# Recycling

- Making good use of recycled bins to collect different categories of waste, including paper, cans, bottles, batteries, CDs and ink cartridges.

# WORKPLACE

# Diversity and inclusion

# Equal Opportunities Policy

The HKMA is an equal opportunities employer. It believes that everyone should be able to work in an environment free of discrimination, harassment, vilification and victimisation. The equal opportunities policy applies to job advertisements, recruitment, terms and conditions of employment, performance assessment, promotion, transfer, training, dismissal, grievance procedures and general conduct.

# Key statistics on diversity

people are central to the work of the HKMA. We value the diversity of our workforce, which has a balanced gender representation and a spectrum of different age groups.

Female representation at the senior management levels, that is, Executive Director and above, made up 31% as of February 2020.

# Human capital key statistics on 1 January 2020

# Quality workplace

To cater for projected operational needs, the HKMA renovated the offices during the year to create an open layout, increase capacity and allow for more efficient use of space. Breakout areas and ergonomic furniture are part of the new office design. To enhance the staff’s physical health, height-adjustable desks were offered to staff members, allowing them to change their postures easily throughout the day between sitting and standing.

Height-adjustable desks improve office ergonomics.

# Staff well-being

The HKMA promotes work-life balance and cares about the health and work safety of the staff. Regular talks on healthy lifestyles, stress management and workplace safety are organised and indoor air quality is monitored. Annual on-site medical check-ups and flu vaccinations are arranged. The HKMA also sponsors a professional counselling service comprising experienced psychologists and social workers.

Throughout the year, different activities are organised to enhance the staff’s physical wellness, promote their sense of belonging, and foster co-operation and team spirit. Interest classes are held for staff members and their families. Inter-organisational and cross-divisional activities such as basketball and football competitions with fellow regulators provide opportunities to socialise.

zh:
# 企業社會責任

香港金融管理局致力履行其企業社會責任，並力求成為負責任且可持續發展的組織。這項承諾體現在各項範疇，包括推動可持續及環保的市場、支持更廣泛的社區、保護環境及培育友善的工作環境。

# 市場

# 綠色與永續的銀行業

氣候變化是影響人類福祉和全球經濟永續發展的重大風險之一。銀行運作的金融部門，作為社會的重要部分，亦將受到影響，因此應更積極地管理氣候風險。香港金管局致力於探討應對此挑戰的方法。在此背景下，香港金管局於5月公布了一數目措施，以推動香港綠色金融的發展，包括採用三個階段的方法來推動綠色和永續銀行業。

# 負責任投資

作為交易所基金的投資管理人，香港金融管理局認為，負責任投資（RI）的概念與其投資工作高度相關。由於香港金融管理局是全球最大的資產所有者之一，因此其對基金經理選擇資產的方式將產生重大影響。

# 我們的理念

香港金管局視RI為一種投資方法，該方法考慮各項環境、社會及管治（環境、社會及管治）因素對長線投資回報及其可持續性的影響。香港金管局認為，強調適當的RI及可持續長線經濟表現，可以更好取得交換基金的投資目標，並減少與其基礎投資相關的環境、社會及管治相關事宜所帶來的風險。

# 我們的原則

香港金融管理局的指導原則是，鑒於長線風險調整後的回報與其他投資相若，一般會優先考慮環境、社會及管治投資。適當情況下，香港金融管理局在其投資過程中採用以下原則，這些原則體現了其作為負責任長線投資者的理念。

# 整合

香港金融管理局將環境、社會及管治因素納入其投資分析程序中，以物色風險及機遇，因其秉持理念認為這些因素可對其投資的長線價值產生重大影響。具體而言，香港金融管理局已將環境、社會及管治因素納入其投資程序，用於公眾及私人市場投資。對於公眾市場投資，香港金融管理局將環境、社會及管治因素納入其債券投資的債務風險分析中。分享香港金融管理局理念的外部管理人會被物色及委任。香港金融管理局會向所有外部管理人傳達其理念，並預期他們以配合的方式，使整體可持續長線經濟表現目標得以實現。對於私人市場投資，香港金融管理局會將其一般合伙人環境、社會及管治政策及實踐作為其調查程序的一部分進行檢視。

# 主動所有權

金管局以一種方式行使於其公共股權持有中的股東權利，以幫助保障其投資的長線價值。金管局相信，以環境、社會及管治因素作指引的負責任的企業行為將有助於長期創造股東價值。金管局的資產經理預期將幫助金管局在相關投資中履行其所有權責任，透過行使投票權及與企業關切，採納積極的股東參與方式。

# 合作

香港金融管理局致力與理念相近的投資者和監管機構攜手，推動投資的長線良好管理。它參與並在公開活動上發言，分享觀點，鼓勵投資界採用責任投資。

請參考儲備資產管理章節，以了解香港金管局在年內就風險投資所進行的工作的細則。

# 推動金融普惠

香港金融管理局非常重視金融普及，並已付出重大努力，以推動社會不同群體獲得基本的銀行服務，以滿足大眾的每日基本需要以及合法企業的營運需要。特別是，香港金融管理局一直與銀行業緊密工作於以下優先考慮的範疇：

鼓勵銀行推出更多體格銀行設施，並制定數碼及創新渠道，以提供基本銀行服務，服務一般公眾，特別是偏遠範疇及公共房屋居民和長者；

促進及監測銀行賬戶對個人和中小企的可及性；

提升銀行服務對具體客戶群體的可及性，例如，殘障客戶和少數民族客戶；

促進並監控中小企獲得銀行信貸的可及性；以及

授予8間虛擬銀行許可證，這些銀行在提供銀行服務時將積極推動金融包容性。

# 社區

# 推動金融知識普及

香港金融管理局透過各項渠道推動財務素養。除了運作教育計劃，推動公眾明智及負責任地運用銀行及金融服務外，香港金融管理局在其重組後的官方網站上設有專頁「精明消費者」，讓公眾可發現涵蓋廣泛的銀行及相關產品和服務的有用資訊和精明提示。此外，亦透過Facebook、LinkedIn、YouTube、Instagram及Twitter等媒體平台，以及香港金融管理局官方網站和研究報告，提供最新的銀行及金融事務資訊。

香港金融管理局資訊中心自2003年起，作為香港金融管理局的重大公眾教育及研究資源，向社區介紹香港金融管理局的工作，並推動公眾對貨幣及銀行事務的認識。資訊中心每日為來自學校及非營利機構的團體訪問學者提供導賞服務。此外，亦為學生舉辦公眾教育研討會及其他活動，以提升他們的財務知識及素養。同時，香港金融管理局亦與投資者及財務教育委員會緊密合作，透過其財務教育平台「陳家駿財經教育基金」推動香港的財務素養。

看到公司功能章節以取得更多關於香港金融管理局於本年期間推動財務素養工作的細則。看到銀行穩定章節以取得更多關於香港金融管理局於本年期間推動財務包容工作的細則。

# 應對特殊群體需要

# 香港紙幣的可及性

2018年紙幣系列保留了前一系列紙幣中用以幫助視障人士區分面額的可及性特點。這些可及性特點包括點字、觸覺線條和高觸覺數字。

為幫助視障人士分辨紙幣的面額，一款由香港按揭證券有限公司贊助、香港盲人社會開發的行動應用程式，會利用手機的相機掃描紙幣圖案以辨識面額。該應用程式可從蘋果應用商店和谷歌應用商店免費下載。另外，由香港按揭證券有限公司及三間發行紙幣銀行贊助的紙幣測量模板亦已推出，用以測量紙幣的長度。該模板可測量2018系列紙幣及現時流通的紙幣。模板一面為點字，另一面為符號。該模板會免費分發予服務視障人士的志願機構。

# 硬幣收藏計劃

在香港硬幣收集計劃下，香港金融管理局與香港社會服務聯會合作，採取硬幣推車在節日當天為非政府組織收集硬幣。

# 公共資訊的可及性

香港金管局推出的全新官方網站於9月正式推出。全新網站加強了導航結構，以促進用戶根據個人喜好進行方便、容易的搜尋。特別是，該網站於「智慧消費者」版塊下設有「其他語言資訊」專頁，提供七種少數族裔社群普遍運用之語言的銀行服務有用資訊，包括印尼語、印地語、尼泊爾語、旁遮普語、塔加拉語、泰語及烏爾都語。

香港金融管理局致力於確保其網站盡最大可能符合萬維網聯盟（W3C）網頁內容可存取性指南（WCAG）2.0第AA級標準，以促進有特殊需要的市民無障礙地接觸其網上資訊。

# 志願服務及慈善活動

香港金融管理局透過擔任義工及慈善活動的**部分**，支持社區服務。**高級**公民家居安全**團體**向香港金融管理局**頒發**社區參與水晶獎，以表彰其參與2018年**愛**心與安心企業參與計劃。

二零一九年香港醫療輔助隊團隊參與的慈善活動

「喂！與年青人同行」由青年外展部主辦。

藝術家及來自社會企業香港殘疾人士藝術團體的代表參觀香港金融管理局辦公室，其藝術作品於此展示。

金管局員工選持倉盤積極參與捐血日、全港地區旗日、社區胸口基金綠色日、愛牙日、午餐跳過日、著裝休閒日以及定期宣傳活動，收集衣物、玩具和其他可重用項目捐贈給慈善團體。

香港金融管理局會員積極選持倉盤參與香港紅十字會舉辦的獻血日活動。

#友善組織

為表彰其致力關懷社區的承諾，香港金融管理局（HKMA）連續第13年獲香港社會服務聯會頒發「10年加友善機構標誌」。

#環境

# 綠色辦公措施

香港金融管理局已設立環境政策，以保護及保本環境。該政策及落實措施定期向其員工當中公布。綠色辦公室措施包括：

# 紙張/影印/列印

- 鼓勵使用再生紙張及信封；
- 以電子副本取代文件的實體副本；
- 在紙張兩面印製；
- 僅在必要時使用彩色印製及複印；
- 避免使用紙杯；以及
- 以環保紙張及油墨印製香港金融管理局年報。

# 耗電量

- 當這些設備未使用時，關掉電腦、印表機、燈光、音響視訊系統及其他電動設備的電源。在預設辦公時間以外使用過水電器、電動衝擊機及碎紙機等設備後，重新啟動這些設備內建的預設省電模式；以及  
- 定期審視正常辦公時間以外是否需要額外的空調。

# 回收

善用回收箱收集不同類別的廢物，包括紙張、罐頭、瓶子、電池、光碟及墨盒。

# 工作環境

# 多元性與包容

# 平等機遇方針

香港金融管理局是一個提供平等 機遇 的僱主。它認為每個人都應該能夠在沒有歧視、騷擾、詆毀和迫害的環境下 工作。 平等 機遇 政策 適用 於 招聘廣告、招聘、條款 及就業條件、績效評估、推廣、調動、培訓、解僱、申訴 程序 和一般 進行。

# 關於多樣性的主要統計數據

市民是香港金融管理局工作的核心。我們重視員工隊伍的多樣性，其中包括性別比例均衡，並涵蓋不同年齡群體。

截至2020年2月，高級管理層中女性佔比為31%，即執行董事及以上職級。

# 2020年1月1日人力資本關鍵統計數據

# 優質的工作環境

為應付預測營運需要，香港金管局在當年翻新辦公室，打造開放式格局，增加容量，並讓空間得到更高效的利用。休憩空間和符合人體工學的家具是新辦公室設計的一部分。為提升員工的體格健康，向會員提供可調節高度的桌子，讓他們在坐與站之間，每天都能容易地更換姿勢。

可調高度的辦公桌能改善辦公室人體工學。

# 員工福祉

金管局推動工作與人壽平衡，並關心員工的健康與工作安全。定期舉辦關於健康生活方式、壓力管理及工作環境安全的研討會，並監察室內空氣品質。每年安排現場醫療檢查及流感疫苗接種。金管局亦贊助一項專業輔導服務，由有經歷的心理學家及社工組成。

全年舉辦不同活動，以提升員工的體格健康，推動他們的歸屬感，並促進合作與團隊精神。為員工及其家屬舉辦興趣班。跨機構及跨部門活動，如與同業監管機構進行的籃球及足球比賽，亦提供社交機遇。
